Posts.Content: This is my first time posting. Appreciate any advice and here's my story: In my first full body checkup at about age 22 for employment fitness purpose, the PSA reads about 3. The Dr did not mention any thing and i was not aware of it too. Sometime at age 25, my PSA grew again and I was asked to go to the Urology Dept to be handled by the Dr there. I do not remember the figure but over the time, I had numerous PSA test and it continously grow, roughly increases by 1 to 2 every year. Dr. gave me ciprofloxaxin and PSA reduced very very slightly. About two years ago, I had biopsy while the PSA was about 7 and test was negative. I also had DRE before the biopsy and Dr. said there is no abnormalies. I did another PSA test in Dec 2009 and it reads 9.8. Dr. said just monitor it and take the test this July 2010 again. I don't have burning feeling while urinating and my sexual life is active and normal. Greatly appreciate if anyone can offer some advices.
Posts.Title: PSA 9.8 at age 30, advice needed

Posts.Content: I have obtained my historical results: Date Age PSA %FreePSA FreePSA 9/9/2003 24 5.1 - - 13/10/2006 27 6.2 - - 1/11/2006 27 7.8 20.8 11/15/2006 27 (Start of Cipro for 2 weeks) 2/12/2006 27 6.946 6 0.448 25/1/2007 27 ----BIOPSY tested negative---- 14/7/2007 27 8.719 4 0.423 30/8/2007 27 6.2 (Start of Cipro for approx 1 mth) 19/11/2007 28 6 (Not much reduction of PSA after Cipro) 2/1/2008 28 6.912 7 0.514 7/1/2009 29 7.74 - - 4/1/2010 30 9.69 6 0.61 I have scheduled an appointment with another local urology specialist this 3/3/2010. I have also wrote to St.Vincent for opinions. Thank you so much guys and I welcome more comments and advices.[/img] *Sorry for difficulty in reading the table, it doesnt come out right when I paste
Posts.Title: PSA 9.8 at age 30, advice needed

Posts.Content: Sorry the table is confusing, here's the proper one: 9/9/2003 age24 PSA=5.1 13/10/2006 age27 PSA=6.2 - - 1/11/2006 age27 PSA=7.8 %PSA=20.8 11/15/2006 age27 (Start of Cipro for 2 weeks) 2/12/2006 age27 PSA=6.946 %FPSA=6 FPSA=0.448 25/1/2007 age27 ----BIOPSY tested negative---- 14/7/2007 age27 PSA=8.719 %FPSA=4 FPSA=0.423 30/8/2007 age27 PSA=6.2 (Start of Cipro for approx 1 mth) 19/11/2007 age28 PSA=6 (Not much reduction of PSA after Cipro) 2/1/2008 age28 PSA=6.912 %FPSA=7 FPSA=0.514 7/1/2009 age29 PSA=7.74 4/1/2010 age30 PSA=9.69 %FPSA=6 FPSA=0.61 It is shocking to me that I am at so high chance of getting prostate cancer judging from the %FPSA.
Posts.Title: PSA 9.8 at age 30, advice needed

Posts.Content: Thanks skippy. I'm actually in Brunei (South East Asia), and a Bruneian. There is only one big Govt hospital here and that's the one I go to. There is another private hospital, I will check it out soon, hopefully there is a good urologist there. The Dr consistently tells me not to worry because it could be my normal baseline to vary in that range. However I doubt he is right, since my PSA consistently rises. I will go for a checkup soon. Thx!
